comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Nice shot from the ground of the machine in flight! Just for the record this is not a F.E.2c as stated in the caption, as The F.E.2c was an experimental night fighter and bomber variant of the F.E.2b, the main change being the switching of the pilot and observer positions so that the pilot had the best view for night landings. Two were built in 1916. The picture shows an FE.2d serial A19, which was one of the first production batch from forty machines (serial A1 to A40) produced by the Royal Aircraft Factory in mid 1916. The FE.2d was the final model of the FE.2 which was powered by a Rolls-Royce Eagle engine with a rating of 250 hp.
